meanings.definition: A mirror image or opposite form
meanings.sent1: The enantiomorph of the shape looked exactly like its mirror image.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the enantiomorphs of the molecule to understand their symmetry.
meanings.sent3: The enantiomorphs of the puzzle pieces were mixed up, creating a funny picture.
meanings.sent4: Her reflection in the mirror seemed like an enantiomorph, a perfect opposite of herself.
meanings.sent5: The enantiomorphs of the butterfly wings were so identical, it was hard to tell them apart.

meanings.definition: One of a pair of optical isomers
meanings.sent1: The chemist identified the enantiomorph as part of the optical isomer pair.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they separated the enantiomorphs to study their individual properties.
meanings.sent3: The enantiomorphs of the glasses made everything look upside down, causing a comical mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The enantiomorph of the molecule was like a twin, sharing the same features but in reverse.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the enantiomorphs of the crystals appeared like intricate mirror images.
